Welcome to PyDoctorSender’s documentation!¶

PyDoctorSender Client¶

class pydoctorsender.doctorsender.DoctorSenderClient(user, token)¶
campaign(campaign_id: int)¶

Gets both the campaign statistics (e.g. Amt Send, Amt Opend) and configuration parameters (e.g. from email) of a given campaign

Parameters

campaign_id – Int

Returns

Dict, empty if the campaign does not exist, else containing the following keys/fields and their values (all as string): ‘status’, ‘amount’, ‘opens’, ‘clicks’, ‘deliveries’, ‘bounced’, ‘complaints’, ‘unsubscribes’, ‘cvars’, ‘unicViews’, ‘unicClics’, ‘id’, ‘category_id’, ‘name’, ‘subject’, ‘from_name’, ‘from_email’, ‘sender’, ‘segment_id’, ‘segment’, ‘user_list’, ‘country’, ‘send_date’, ‘reply_to’, ‘list_unsubscribe’, ‘bounceds_soft’

categories()¶

Get all categories Static function, should never change

Returns

Dict containing category id as key and category name as value

countries()¶

Get all countries Static function, should never change

Returns

Dict containing country iso-3 code as key and country name as value

create_campaign(campaign_name: str, subject: str, from_name: str, from_email: str, reply_to: str, html: str, plain: str, template_id: int = '', category_id: int = 1, country: str = 'GER', language_id: int = 3, list_unsubscribe: str = '', utm_campaign: str = '', utm_term: str = '', utm_content: str = '', footer_usub_link: str = '', mirror_link: str = '')¶

Creates (but not sends) a new campaign

Parameters

  • campaign_name – String with the name of the campaign

  • subject – String with the email subject

  • from_name – String with the from name for that email

  • from_email – String with the from email for that email, the email needs be to available in drs (can be checked with dsSettingsGetAllFromEmail)

  • reply_to – String with the from email for that email, also needs to be set up and available

  • html – Html template for the email

  • plain – Text template for the email

  • template_id – int of the template (header and footer) to be used

  • category_id – The category id, all categories with their id can be retrieved with dsCategoryGetAll

  • country – The iso3 country code for that mailing, can be retrieved with dsCountryGetAll

  • language_id – The language id, can be retrieved with dsLanguageGetAll

Returns

Int with the id of the new campaign

create_segment(list_name: str, segment_name: str, is_virtual: bool = False) → int¶

Create a new segment without any conditions

Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_segments.html#a480ce73993491e184b94a45ac0c04f23

Parameters

  • list_name – String with the list name as displayed in Doctorsender

  • segment_name – String of the name of the new segment

  • is_virtual – Bool, Virtual means invisible, set to False when Segment should be visible in the GUI

Returns

Int with the new segment_id

delete_campaign(campaign_id: int) → bool¶

Delete a campaign

Warning: Will also return True if the campaign did not exist in the first place

Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_campaign.html#a4a57c512898aab19aed88ac82c536c5e

Parameters

segment_id – Id of the segment the condition applies for

Returns

Boolean if deletion was successful

Warning: Will also return True if the segment did not exist in the first place

Parameters

segment_id – Id of the segment the condition applies for

Returns

Boolean if deletion was successful

Get all account from-emails

Returns

List containing all available email addresses

ftp_data()¶
ip_groups() → list¶

Get all account ip-groups

Returns

List containing the name of all ip-groups

languages() → dict¶

Get all languages Static function, should never change

Returns

Dict containing language id as key and language name as value

lists(test_lists=0)¶

Get all user lists in the account

Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_users.html#a3bd42970a9819091a5220cfed0b578c0

Parameters

test_lists – 1 to only get Testlists, 0 to get only get non-test lists and ‘’ to get all available lists

Returns

DrsResponse object, .content returns a dict with segment_id as key and segment_name as value

segment_add_condition(segment_id: int, field_name: str, comparator: str, value: str, is_or: bool = False, is_date: bool = False)¶

Add a new condition to an existing segment

Notes: Each field can only have one condition, the api (.content in return object) returns false if the field does not exists

Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_segments.html#a6a8492fe606dee505fc335832b45f217

Parameters

  • segment_id – Id of the segment the condition shall apply for

  • field_name – The field the condition compares against

  • comparator – String, valid comparators are: <, >, ==, !=, <=, >=, like, not like, in, not in, segment

  • value – String, value the field shall be compared with

  • is_or – Boolean, only works if comparator is ‘segment’

  • is_date – Boolean, set to true if the value is a date

Returns

Int with amount of users in this segment after adding condition

segment_count(segment_id: int) → int¶

Count users in a segment

Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_segments.html#a6a91a9d148530550258f4c752b13517d

Parameters

segment_id – int with the segment id

Returns

DrsResponse object, .content returns string with the number of users in the segment

segment_del_condition(segment_id: int, field_name: str)¶

Removed the condition for a given field in a given segment

Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_segments.html#a43b4a364c02d1bd151e5e4f79e166c68

Parameters

  • segment_id – Id of the segment the condition applies for

  • field_name – The field name of the condition

Returns

DrsResponse object, .content returns string with amount of users in the segment after removing condition

segments(listname: str)¶

Gets all segments for a given list Doc: http://soapwebservice.doctorsender.com/doxy/html/classds_segments.html#a6e4e54b8a7ebac3119e9724db6668ee9 :param listname: String with the list name as displayed in Doctorsender :return: DrsResponse object, .content returns a dict with segment_id as key and segment_name as value

send_campaign_test(campaign_id: int, emails: list) → bool¶

Send test emails for a given campaign

Parameters

  • campaign_id – Int with the id of the campaign to be send

  • emails – List of valid email addresses

Returns

DrsResponse object, .content returns string with bool if test sendout was successful

PyDoctorSender Errors¶

exception pydoctorsender.errors.DrsCampaignError

Raised when Doctorsender returns an Error.

exception pydoctorsender.errors.DrsListError

Raised when a List is called that does not exist.

exception pydoctorsender.errors.DrsReturnError

Raised when Doctorsender returns an Error.

exception pydoctorsender.errors.DrsSegmentError

Raised when the Segment does not exist or is wrongfully constructed.

exception pydoctorsender.errors.Error

Base class for other exceptions.

PyDoctorSender Response¶

class pydoctorsender.response.DrsResponse(res)¶

The DrsResponse object deals with the (pretty convoluted) xml response of the Doctorsender API

content¶
Returns

Returns the inner content of the API response (remove all unnecessary stuff around
